text:
Dr. Şerif Furkan SUNGUR
Sonuç ve Öneriler
TETKİK: KAROTİS VE VERTEBRAL ARTER DOPPLER US
Karotis arter sistemi ekstrakranial segmentlerinin bakısında, anlamlı yapısal ya da hemodinamik patoloji saptanmadı. Akım hızları ve dalga formları doğal değerlendirildi. Hemodinamik değişiklik oluşturacak derecede anlamlı oranda lümen daralması gözlenmedi.
Her iki CCA 'da intima-media kalınlaşması mevcuttur. Sağ juguler ven ektazik görünümdedir.
Sağ CCA orta kesimde anterior duvarda yaklaşık 8 mm 'lik segmentte, yaklaşık 1.8 mm kalınlığa ulaşan ve lümende anlamlı hız artışı oluşturmayan yumuşak ağırlıklı mikst plak formasyonu izlendi.
Sağ CCA bulbus düzeyinde posterior duvarda yaklaşık 5.5 mm 'lik segmentte, yaklaşık 2.5 mm kalınlığa ulaşan ve lümende anlamlı hız
artışı oluşturmayan kalsifik ağırlıklı mikst plak formasyonu izlendi.
Sol CCA proksimal kesimde medial duvarda uzun bir segmentte, yaklaşık 2.1 mm kalınlığa ulaşan ve lümende anlamlı hız artışı oluşturmayan kresentik tarzda kalsifik ağırlıklı mikst plak formasyonu izlendi.
trans:
Dr. Şerif Furkan SUNGUR
Conclusions and Recommendations
EXAMINATION: CAROTID AND VERTEBRAL ARTERY DOPPLER ULTRASONOGRAPHY
No significant structural or hemodynamic pathology was detected in the extracranial segments of the carotid artery system. Flow velocities and waveforms were evaluated as normal. No significant luminal narrowing causing hemodynamic changes was observed.
Intima-media thickening is present in both common carotid arteries (CCAs). The right jugular vein appears ectatic.
In the midsection of the right CCA, on the anterior wall, a soft-mixed plaque formation measuring approximately 8 mm in length and reaching about 1.8 mm in thickness was observed, which does not cause significant velocity increase in the lumen.
At the level of the right CCA bulb, on the posterior wall, a calcific-mixed plaque formation measuring approximately 5.5 mm in length and reaching about 2.5 mm in thickness was observed,
which does not cause significant velocity increase in the lumen.
In the proximal section of the left CCA, on the medial wall, a crescent-shaped calcific-mixed plaque formation was observed over a long segment, reaching approximately 2.1 mm in thickness, and does not cause significant velocity increase in the lumen.
